sense.name: quality or appearance of a surface texture
sense.examples: This paint color comes in five different finishes. Mary prefers this face powder that gives a matte finish. He applied three coats of clear finish.

sense.name: final stage of an event or activity
sense.examples: The wedding was perfect from start to finish. Whoever has the most points at the finish of the game wins. A bowl of raspberries is the perfect finish to a summer dinner. (eating them is the last event of the activity) The political campaign will be a fight to the finish. The golfer's best finish in a major tournament was third place.

sense.name: having cultural refinement, poise
sense.examples: He'll need more finish to become headwaiter at a 3-star restaurant. Her piano playing is exuberant and daring, but lacks a certain finish. They hoped the year abroad would add some finish to their rather provincial offspring.

sense.name: the location of the end of a racetrack
sense.examples: The jockey saw the finish and urged his horse on. A yellow buoy and the committee boat mark the finish of the regatta. The first runner to complete the marathon broke through the tape stretched across the finish.

sense.name: the downfall of someone or something
sense.examples: Getting caught taking illegal steroids was the tragic finish of that athlete. A plague or a famine may have been the finish of their civilization. Too much success at an early age proved to be the finish of the writer.

sense.name: the lingering taste of wine on back of the tongue
sense.examples: The wine has a dry mouth but a rather opulent finish of dark fruit. He enjoyed the tart, almost citrus finish of the crisp white sauvignon blanc.
